questions.question: Why was national attention drawn to William Jennings Bryan and Clarence Darrow in the Scopes trial of 1925?

choices.answer: The case represented a conflict between modern science and religion.
The case reversed a previous Supreme Court decision on free speech.
The case upheld the right of veterans to protest in Washington D.C.
The case revealed the extent of prejudice against immigrants.

questions.question: Which management innovation helped Henry Ford to realize his vision?

choices.answer: providing various models of cars.
downsizing the labor force.
creating a business monopoly.
using assembly-line production methods.

questions.question: Which American author's works are closely associated with the Harlem Renaissance of the 1920's?

choices.answer: F. Scott Fitzgerald
Langston Hughes
Upton Sinclair
John Steinbeck

questions.question: Which factor played the largest role in fueling the economic boom of the 1920's?

choices.answer: government subsidies paid to farmers.
the increasing ownership of automobiles by families.
tariff reductions on imported European goods.
construction of the Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA).

questions.question: The executions of Sacco and Vanzetti in the 1920's demonstrated the --

choices.answer: federal government's war on crime.
corruption of political machines.
the persistence of lynchings.
increase in Nativist attitudes.

questions.question: Based on the timeline, which conclusion can be drawn about the influence of the automobile?

choices.answer: Automobiles created large scale unemployment in certain cities.
The automobile had little economic impact on the United States.
The growth of automobiles had a dramatic effect on life in the U.S.
Henry Ford produced automobiles at a price most Americans could afford.

questions.question: Prohibition, established by the 18th amendment, stated that --

choices.answer: only imported alcoholic beverages could be sold.
the manufacture and sale of alcoholic beverages was banned.
Americans must be 18 years old to purchase alcoholic beverages.
alcoholic beverages could be sold only in government run stores.

questions.question: During the 1920's, Congress passed a series of immigration laws that were primarily designed to --

choices.answer: increase immigration from Asia.
expand the workforce for the growing economy.
limit immigration from Southern and Eastern Europe.
prohibit immigration from Latin America.

questions.question: Which development in the 1920's was inconsistent with much of the racial and ethnic intolerance of the decade?

choices.answer: The Red Scare
The Harlem Renaissance
The revival of the Ku Klux Klan
The trial of Sacco and Vanzetti

questions.question: Which event represented an expression of nativism during the 1920's?

choices.answer: The trial of John Scopes for teaching evolution.
Charles Lindbergh's tran-Atlantic solo flight.
The adoption of a quote system to limit immigration.
The rise in the popularity of spectator sports.

questions.question: One purpose of this poem, written by Langston Hughes in 1922, was to --

choices.answer: explain the advantages of inner city living.
discuss ideas in the language used by immigrant Americans.
ask African Americans to accept things as they are.
encourage African Americans to continue their struggle for equality.

questions.question: During the first three decades of the 20th century, what was the main reason many African Americans left the south?

choices.answer: The Dawes Act made free land available in the west.
More factory jobs were available in the north.
Many white landowners refused to accept them as sharecroppers.
Racial discrimination did not occur in states outside the south.

questions.question: What was an important result of Prohibition during the 1920's?

choices.answer: Respect for the law decreased.
Racial prejudice increased.
Women's suffrage was restricted.
Religious tolerance grew.

questions.question: What would a study of "flappers" in the 1920's indicate?

choices.answer: Some women rejected traditional restrictions.
Women were barred from traditionally male occupations.
Many women were elected to national public office.
The earning power of women equaled that of men in most occupations.

questions.question: What was Frances Willard's contribution to American society?

choices.answer: She helped overturn the 18th amendment.
She fought for women's rights and the ban on the sale of alcohol.
She spoke out against the introduction of eugenics.
She spearheaded important innovations in manufacturing.

questions.question: Based on the chart, what effect did the passage of immigration laws have on immigration to the U.S.?

choices.answer: They ended all immigration to the U.S.
The number of immigrants from southern/eastern Europe and Asia declined.
The had little effect on the flow of immigrants entering the U.S.
The number of immigrants from northern and western Europe increased.

questions.question: According to Vanzetti, why was he found guilty in his trial?

choices.answer: He had strongly supported eugenic laws.
He was convicted because he was an immigrant with radical views.
He was the victim of a scandal from the Harding administration.
He violated the 18th Amendment, calling for prohibition.

questions.question: Which individual encouraged African-Americans to own their own businesses and started a back to Africa movement?

choices.answer: Charles Lindbergh
Glenn Curtiss
Marcus Garvey
William Jennings Bryan

questions.question: The cartoon shows attempts of the U.S. government to deal with the issue of --

choices.answer: foreign trade
immigration
transportation gridlocks
migrant workers

questions.question: What did President Harding mean when he introduced the phrase a "return to normalcy" after World War I?

choices.answer: increased U.S. involvement in Europe.
going back to a peacetime economy.
no longer selling liquor in the U.S.
restoring a Democratic president to power.

questions.question: Which aspect of the 1920's is most closely identified with the emergence of Tin Pan Alley?

choices.answer: the printing and distribution of Prohibition pamphlets.
the location of the music publishing industry in New York City.
the successful flight of the first hydroplane in North Carolina.
the repeal of the 21st amendment.

questions.question: What management innovation for improved production is illustrated in this picture?

choices.answer: Bessemer Process
robotics
assembly line
unionization
